Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery Type B kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centre; top of rim glazed; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis) (noted in Gardner's plate)
Curator's comments: Williams (Williams 1983, 185, note 59) interprets the dedication as coming from a hetaira from Naukratis, ‘Aiguptis’ (with the T omitted). The number '13' is written in pencil on the sherd's exterior. Many kantharoi Type B (See Williams 1983, 169) have painted inscriptions beneath the rim and several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 63, no. 746, pl. XXI, no. 746)
Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 169, no. 158, pl. 35, no. 21)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 681, no. 397, pl. 24.1.27)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1728) (phase 2)
